snippet: The battle of “the two ladies,” Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina and the opposition leader Khaleda Zia, has led to more than 100 deaths and has hurt the crucial garment industry.
abstract: Battle between Bangladeshi Prime Min Sheikh Hasina and opposition leader Khaleda Zia has resulted in violent protests that have killed over 100 people, injured many others, and stirred general unrest that has hurt country's economy; turmoil stems from clash between Hasina and Zia, known as country's 'two ladies,' over 2014 election.
lead_paragraph: The battle of “the two ladies,” Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina and the opposition leader Khaleda Zia, has led to more than 100 deaths and has hurt the crucial garment industry.

headline.main: Turmoil Between Political Leaders Has Harmed Bangladesh’s People
headline.print_headline: The Many Casualties of the Battle of ‘the Two Ladies’
